ref_item.label: THUNDERBEAT
ref_item.description: THUNDERBEAT energy device ( Olympus) will be used for dissection of tissue and ligation of vessels

pred_item.label: Group 1: THUNDERBEAT
pred_item.description: Patients undergoing left laparoscopic colectomy assigned to the group where the THUNDERBEAT energy device is used for dissection and vessel sealing.

ref_item.label: LIGASURE
ref_item.description: LIGASURE energy device will be used for dissection of tissue and ligation of vessels

pred_item.label: Group 2: LigaSure
pred_item.description: Patients undergoing left laparoscopic colectomy assigned to the group where the Maryland LigaSure energy device is used for dissection and vessel sealing.

pred_item.name: THUNDERBEAT
pred_item.description: A multi-functional energy device (5 mm to 35 cm; Olympus, Japan) which delivers simultaneously ultrasonic and bipolar energy. It allows surgeons to seal and safely divide blood vessels up to 7 mm, cut, and dissect omental and mesentery tissue.

pred_item.name: Maryland LigaSure
pred_item.description: An FDA-approved bipolar electrosurgical device (5 mm to 37 cm; Medtronic, USA) used for tissue dissection and vessel ligation. It consists of the LigaSure device and Generator-Force Triad.

ref_item.measure: Overall Time for Dissection of the Soft Tissues
ref_item.description: from the start of colon mobilization to specimen removal from the abdominal cavity

pred_item.description: Time measured in minutes from the start of colon mobilization to specimen removal from the abdominal cavity.

ref_item.description: Total/Composite score (composite of 5 variables:hemostasis;sealing;cutting;dissection;and tissue manipulation) was measured by a score system from 1 to 5 (1 being worst and 5 best) for each of the 5 variables,weighted by Coefficient of Importance with weight distribution as follow: hemostasis 0.275, sealing 0.275, cutting 0.2, dissection 0.15, and tissue Manipulation 0.1.). The final reported score is a weighted average.

pred_item.description: Composite of five variables (hemostasis, sealing, cutting, dissection, and tissue manipulation) measured by a score system from 1 to 5 (1 being worst and 5 the best) for each of six specific segments, adjusted/weighted by coefficient of importance.

ref_item.measure: Length of Post Surgical Stay in the Hospital
ref_item.description: Length of post surgical stay in the hospital measured in days
ref_item.timeFrame: from Surgery date to the discharge date from the hospital up to 30 days

ref_item.measure: Dryness of the Surgical Field Average Score Mean/sd
ref_item.description: Measured by score from 1 to 5 where 1 means Heavy bleeding , hemostasis achieved with the instrument with more than 2 attempts, and 5 means No oozing at vessel or tissue site in entire surgical field .

pred_item.description: Evaluation of the entire surgical field for overall oozing of blood or any other body fluids using a scoring system from 1 to 5.

ref_item.measure: Intraoperative Complication Related to the Energy Devices
ref_item.description: Intraoperative adverse event occurrences during surgery due to the energy devices (THUNDERBEAT and LigaSure) measured as categorical variable "Yes" or "No"

ref_item.measure: Delayed Thermal Injuries Related to Energy Devices
ref_item.description: Delayed thermal injuries related to Energy devices that occur after surgery within 30 days of the surgical date, measured as categorical variables "Yes" or "No".
operative procedure time measured in minutes from the start of the incision to the last stitch in the closure of the surgical incision

pred_item.description: Survey evaluating the surgeonâ€™s opinion on the instrument consisting of 8 questions on a scale from 1 to 10, where a score of 1 is worst and 10 is the best.
